attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Petition of qualified public service interpreters registered on the National Register of Public Service Interpreters 
declares that the Petitioners are concerned about an article in The Times on Friday 17 July 2009:
 
"Jack Straw, the Justice Secretary, told The Times that he also wanted to cut the £127 million a year in legal aid that is spent on expert witnesses in court, including interpreters. The costs of such experts in criminal and civil trials are included in solicitors’ legal aid costs."

The Petitioners therefore request the removal of interpreting and translation costs from the solicitors’ fees to be paid as disbursements (as is now done in asylum cases) keeping the present payment structure and scales in place as interpreting and translation fees have not increased for a number of years.
